With microservices and ever-increasing demand, applications are constantly becoming more complex, and so is managing access to them. We keep rebuilding Access Control, yet it remains broken. In this episode, the founder of Permit.io will review the 5 best practices we can follow, and open-source tools (OPA, OPAL, Zanizabr) we can adopt to get permissions and access control right once and for all.

OR WEIS
Or is the CEO and co-founder of Permit.io, co-maintainer, and author of open source OPAL.ac. Or is a serial entrepreneur who is passionate about developer tools, previously founding Rookout.com, a leading production debugging solution; and managing Upwards Israel‚Äôs largest founders‚Äô PLG community. Before becoming a founder, Or worked as a lead engineer in multiple cybersecurity and big data companies, the intelligence corps, as a consultant for the Ministry of Defense, and as VP R&D at Netline CT cyber division.
